verses.verse: (Immorality Defiles the Church) It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles—that a man has his father’s (Lev. 18:6-8; Deut. 22:30; 27:20) wife!
(1 Cor. 4:18) And you are puffed up, and have not rather (2 Cor. 7:7-10) mourned, that he who has done this deed might be taken away from among you.
(Col. 2:5; 1 Thess. 2:17) For I indeed, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged (as though I were present) him who has so done this deed.
In the ((Matt. 18:20)) name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together, along with my spirit, ((Matt. 16:19; John 20:23); 2 Cor. 12:9) with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
(Ps. 109:6; Prov. 23:14; Luke 22:31; 1 Tim. 1:20) deliver such a one to ((Acts 26:18)) Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
(1 Cor. 3:21) Your glorying is not good. Do you not know that (Hos. 7:4; Matt. 16:6, 12; Gal. 5:9; 2 Tim. 2:17) a little leaven leavens the whole lump?
Therefore purge out the old leaven, that you may be a new lump, since you truly are unleavened. For indeed (Is. 53:7) Christ, our (John 19:14) Passover, was sacrificed for us.
Therefore (Ex. 12:15) let us keep the feast, (Deut. 16:3) not with old leaven, nor (Matt. 16:6) with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
(Immorality Must Be Judged) I wrote to you in my epistle (2 Cor. 6:14; Eph. 5:11; 2 Thess. 3:6) not to keep company with sexually immoral people.
Yet I certainly did not mean with the sexually immoral people of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or idolaters, since then you would need to go (John 17:15) out of the world.

But now I have written to you not to keep company (Matt. 18:17) with anyone named a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner— (Gal. 2:12) not even to eat with such a person.
For what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside?
But those who are outside God judges. Therefore (Deut. 13:5; 17:7, 12; 19:19; 21:21; 22:21, 24; 24:7; 1 Cor. 5:2) “put away from yourselves the evil person.”
